comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; en-US; rv:1.9.1.16) Gecko/20101123 SeaMonkey/2.0.11
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; en-US; rv:1.9.1.16) Gecko/20101123 SeaMonkey/2.0.11

The above URL displays as one page in both Seamonkey and Safari.  However, when I try to print it, Seamonkey prints it as two pages.  The right column on page one, and the left column on page two.

Safari prints it correctly with both columns on the same page.

This might be a dupe of bug 216652 and/or bug 354131, but I don't know what the root cause is for any of these problems.

Reproducible: Always
comments.creator: mozilla.org@timur.tabi.org

comments.raw_text:
WFM with FF trunk.

I'll bet this is WFY on trunk. And if it doesn't it's probably something related to header and footer.

(please set vers=trunk only if you tested trunk)
